Name: Stela of Ptolemy the Second
Description: This stela of King Ptolemy the Second, Philadelphus, is dominated by an offering scene divided into two parts. On the right side, the king is shown presenting offerings to the goddess Maat of Justice, the god Horus of the sun, the mother goddess Isis, and the deified Queen Arsinoe the Second. On the left side, the king, followed by Isis and the queen, offers wine and the eye of Horus to the same deities.
